column4: Hi. I installed Linux Mint and then removed all packages from Linux Mint and removed the repository, but now my GRUB and Plymouth themes are the same. How do I revert them?
Use each one and see which you like.
hasn't Mint upgraded to Debian?
No, that's LMDE -- Linux Mint Debian Edition. It's rolling release.
oh, okay. Rolling release sounds good.
It's got some kinks to work out.
armegeddon466. Says his password is wrong.
It wouldn't say his password would be wrong.
true.
swap can only be swap
What do you mean?
Swap is RAM, just on your hard drive. RAM holds a lot of sensitive information.
no, nevermind, icarus-c's answer showed me I'm ignorant.
because bazhang will tell you off for talking about other distros in #ubuntu
mobasher: He's coming from California.
or his proxy is...
It's a residential gateway. Highly doubtful it's a proxy.
he'd say that if he were from China! o.o
lol
in packages.ubuntu.com you can search which packages have which files.
You could just do dpkg -S.
that too.
